result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel A. Pesl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samuel A. Pesl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samuel A. Pesl was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel A. Pesl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction - includes cover letter from DOC
Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

10:33 a.m. Defendant Samuel A. Pesl in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM468,15CM410. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Michlig speaks to agreement/resolution. State moves to dismiss Cts. 1 & 2 in 15CM468 and Case 15CM410; granted by the Court. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 3 in 15CM468. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Laska statement to sentencing. Court statement. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Court sentence
WHS
1 yr. POP
Alcohol assessment and compliance
Full-time employment or education--or combination of both
CC/CV/Supervision
DNA sample
DNA surcharge
Appeal Rights
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Defendant Samuel A. Pesl in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:28
Defendant makes voluntary appearance --was told today not on the 16th - confirmed done in error with JA - Any warrant authorizes quashed
In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea - 
Bond reinstated -  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samuel A. Pesl not in court.  Steven M MIchlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:41
No appearance by defendant - he had requested the VA - Warrant to remain and done by DA's office  - Per Judge - there will not be another voluntary appearance..
3:05 p.m. Defendant Samuel A. Pesl not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:07 p.m.

3:28 p.m. Defendant Samuel A. Pesl in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to counsel - Defendant states he has contacted DA's office and Bednar - Clemens is on vacation - he has done nothing to contact defense attorney - Court instructs defendant to contact PD's office, hire private counsel or complete application for Court appointed attorney. Bail continued. Adj. 3:32 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

2:18 P.M. Defendant Samuel A. Pesl in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 2:21 p.m.
